input.description: The timeout value is seconds. This is the time after which the command will timeout regardless of whether the command execution is complete or not.
domain-name [Required]: Specifies the name of the policy domain to which the schedule belongs. Valid values: The domain-name whom the targeted schedule belongs to.
schedule-name [Required]: Specifies the name of the schedule that you want to associate with one or more clients. Valid values: The targeted schedule name.

nodes-name [Required]: Specifies the name of a client node or a list of client nodes to associate with the specified schedule. Use commas to separate the items in the list. Do not leave spaces between the items and commas. The command will not associate a listed client to the schedule if: - The client is already associated with the specified schedule. - The client is not assigned to the policy domain to which the schedule belongs. - The client is a NAS node name. All NAS nodes are ignored.
Valid values: The targeted node/nodes, wildcard character.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">create-association</xsl:text> </operation-name> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeout secs}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> <command-options> <domain-name> <xsl:value-of select="'${domain name}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </domain-name> <schedule-name> <xsl:value-of select="'${schedule name}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </schedule-name> <nodes-name> <xsl:value-of select="'${nodes name}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </nodes-name> </command-options> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: This wrapper generates item xml for - create association operations.
